meanings.definition: Work excessively hard or too much.
meanings.sent1: She was overtoiling in the garden under the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overtoil himself by taking on too many tasks at once.
meanings.sent3: After overtoiling all day, she finally collapsed on the couch in exhaustion.
meanings.sent4: The machine groaned under the weight of overtoiling for hours without a break.
meanings.sent5: The image of him overtoiling in the fields stayed with her long after she left.

meanings.sent1: Overtoiling in the factory left him drained of all energy.
meanings.sent2: She could see the effects of overtoiling reflected in his tired eyes.
meanings.sent3: The robot comically overtoiled itself trying to keep up with the fast-paced assembly line.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine sounded like it was overtoiling to climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The thought of overtoiling through another day of work made her shudder.
